Michele Grimston.name: Michele Grimston
Michele Grimston.title: 10 PRINT CHR$(205.5+RND(1)); : GOTO 10
Michele Grimston.description: 10PRINT explores the relationship between labour and identity in a computer-driven world. This artwork laboriously executes by hand a program consisting of a single line of code, created in the computer language BASIC in the 1980s. Through replicating this random, infinite pattern with hand-embroidery, this work questions the value of labour performed by both humans and machines. It asks whether some part of our humanity may be lost when we command computers and machines to complete the mundane everyday which forms the bedrock of our existence, and whether increased efficiency and productivity is a worthy trade for this loss.

Tanya Cummins.name: Tanya Cummins
Tanya Cummins.title: Colour Circle
Tanya Cummins.description: This animation is intended to mimic the patterns made by a spirograph.

Rebecca Corps.name: Rebecca Corps
Rebecca Corps.title: Birds
Rebecca Corps.description: I am intrigued with the randomness of this code and it reminds me of a flock of birds as they move and sometimes become one shape, then separate again.    .
